answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found a couple of articles which discuss the deals made with unions over forgoing cost of living wage increases. 
In Seattle a deal was tentatively made with labor unions over the issue.
http://crosscut.com/2010/09/10/seattle-city-hall/20148/McGinn,-labor-unions-agree-on-smaller-pay-hikes/
Portland, OR made a deal with labor unions where health benefits were preserved in exchange for wage increases.
http://www.theoutlookonline.com/news/story.php?story_id=131603613937548700 
In Baltimore police unions agreed to forgo pay raises in exchange for placing a hold on lay-offs for the next three years.
http://foplodge4.org/general-news/unions-agree-to-no-raises-increased-pension-contributions/
A similar agreement was reached with Firefighters in North Las Vegas.
http://www.lvrj.com/news/north-las-vegas-firefighters-agree-to-forgo-raises-to-avoid-layoffs-95038434.html 
I hope these help as a start!
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Jeffrey Stonehill
text: Communities across the nation are struggling with a variety of strategies for balancing tough budgets. One possible tool are revised agreements with labor unions to forgo scheduled cost of living raises. As opposed to just not receiving a raise, various methods exist to repay employees long term for a short term sacrifice. Can other communities give examples of such agreements? Specifically, ones that had to be negotiated in a union environment? Thanks.
title: Agreements with Unionized Workers to Forgo Raises
